Variable Documentation

W Creature

Creature class.

This class implements a prototype of simulated organic objects. (creature)

  • .uwidth/.uheight/.udepth: number of unit-sized cells creature physically occupies
    Parameters:
    {Object} args extend/override constructor w/ this passed args object
    Test:
    default construction

W Creature prototype add

Initial value:

 function(skill){
  
  skill.creature = this;
  this.skills[skill.name] = skill;
}

Definition at line 80 of file Creature.js.

W Creature prototype clone

Initial value:

 function(){
  var clone = new W.Creature();
  for(var i in this){
    
    if(i != 'body' && i != 'img')
      eval('clone.'+ i +' = this["'+ i +'"];');
  }
  return clone;
}
clone this creature and return the clone

Returns:
{Creature} creature the product of cloning
Test:
add creature with cloning
Test:
clones on iPhone-sized world

Definition at line 113 of file Creature.js.

W Creature prototype moveTo

Initial value:

 function(row, col){
  var other = this.world.at(row, col);
  if(!other){
    this.world.matrix[row][col] = this.id;
    this.world.matrix[this.row][this.col] = -1;
    this.row = row;  
    this.col = col;  

    
    if(this.actQueue.length != 0)  
      this.act = this.actQueue.shift();  
  }else this.other(other);  
}
move onto the given coordinate

Parameters:
{Integer} row row
{Integer} col colume

Definition at line 216 of file Creature.js.

W Creature prototype turnTo

turn to the specified direction

Parameters:
{String} op operation to execute
Returns:
{Boolean} true if the op commands direction change
Note:
handles only following actions: 'rturn,left,right,backward,north,east,south,west'

Definition at line 324 of file Creature.js.

W Creature prototype reserve

Initial value:

 function(scenario){
  scenario += '';
  this.actQueue = this.actQueue.concat(scenario.split(','));
}
